Node.Text: It's too late now to explain. Good luck, Mr. Devlin! If you are not a viper, then I wish you the best.
Node.Hint: James is fleeing to the basement, so he will not be present tonight. He can't be the killer.

Node.Text: Ten days ago, the bear died. Five days ago, the eagle fell from her perch. Today, it will be the lamb. And so the fox flees to remain safe.
The one with the white roses! The other woman, the viper, is going to strike her tonight!
Node.Hint: Caroline is the lamb, so she cannot be the killer. Which other woman is the viper?

Node.Text: You still don't know? It is she with the gleam of gold in her eye, the poison-brewer, flower lover, and murderer!
The nightshade will strangle the white rose!
Node.Hint: James believes that someone symbolized by purple will kill someone symbolized by white roses.

Node.Text: Now, I really must go, before it's too late! Good luck, Mr. Devlin!
